agenda.description: SENATE NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: State Affairs TIME & DATE: 9:00 AM, Thursday, March 14, 2019 PLACE: Senate Chamber CHAIR: Senator Joan Huffman To consider the following: SB 12 Huffman | et al. Relating to the contributions to the Teacher Retirement System of Texas. SB 20 Huffman | et al. Relating to the prosecution of, penalties for, and other consequences of prostitution, trafficking of persons, and related criminal offenses, the admissibility of evidence in the prosecutions of those offenses, and orders of nondisclosure for persons who committed certain of those offenses; regulating occupations and property to prevent and respond to those criminal offenses, including requiring a student occupational permit for those purposes; authorizing fees; increasing criminal penalties; creating criminal offenses. SB 250 Zaffirini Relating to civil liability for removing certain animals from a motor vehicle. SB 366 Watson Relating to the content of detailed reports filed by lobbyists and to monetary limits on expenditures by lobbyists. SB 548 Birdwell | et al. Relating to complaints filed with and certain other filings submitted to the Texas Ethics Commission. SB 667 Zaffirini Relating to guardianships, management trusts, and certain other procedures and proceedings for persons who are incapacitated. SB 702 Bettencourt Relating to the authorization and reporting of expenditures for lobbying activities by certain political subdivisions and other public entities. SB 827 Huffman Relating to the transfer of civil cases by the judicial panel on multidistrict litigation. SB 923 Huffman Relating to restrictions on the age of persons employed by or allowed on the premises of a sexually oriented business; creating a criminal offense. Public testimony will be limited to 2 minutes. If submitting written testimony, please provide 20 copies to the committee clerk with your name on each.
